title: [Large-Scale] Knowledge Management Strategies for Innovative Performance Creation

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of foundational innovation theory and collaborative processes
context.additional_context: Students analyze exploration and exploitation strategies in team-based innovation projects and simulate how collaborative experiences affect team performance.

learning_goals: Students can justify the optimal allocation ratio of knowledge exploration and utilization for creating innovative outcomes.
The difference in knowledge learning effects based on collaborative experiences can be explained through data-driven case analysis.
Strategic differences between successful and failed innovation cases can be derived through patent data analysis.

resources: U.S. Patent Office Public Data Sample

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
